title: Argentine Chamber of Deputies
summary: The Chamber of Deputies (Spanish: C치mara de Diputados de la Naci칩n) is the lower house of the Argentine National Congress (Spanish: Congreso de la Naci칩n). It is made up of 257 national deputies who are elected in multi-member constituencies corresponding with the territories of the 23 provinces of Argentina (plus the Federal Capital) by party list proportional representation. Elections to the Chamber are held every two years, so that half of its members are up in each election, making it a rare example of staggered elections used in a lower house.
